Why do some antivirus software flag Verus as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Some antivirus software, such as Avast and Kaspersky, may flag Verus as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" (Potentially Unwanted Program) because it is mining software. This warning is intended to inform users that they are installing software that may be used to mine cryptocurrency, which could potentially be exploited by a third party to use their computer's resources without their knowledge or consent.

If your antivirus software flags Verus as a potential threat, you can review the resources provided by the antivirus software to understand the reason for the warning.
